title: Jacksonville police locate second body after Tuesday drive-by shooting near Edward Waters College
content:
The Jacksonville Sheriff’s Office cordoned off a two block section of West 10th Street in Jacksonville near Edward Waters College after a body was discovered in a drainage ditch Wednesday.
The Sheriff’s Office announced in a press release that the individual is “another victim” from a drive-by shooting Tuesday evening on nearby Ella Street but did not provide any other information. The Sheriff’s Office chose not to conduct a media briefing at the scene.
A dive team at the scene focused on a ditch near McMillan Street on Wednesday afternoon between Ninth and 10th streets.
The Tuesday shooting, which left 18-year-old Anthony D. Ray dead and three others injured, was possibly sparked by a fight earlier in the day, according to the Jacksonville Sheriff’s Office. Police say they found Ray shot to death in a ditch along Ella Street. The Wednesday afternoon crime scene is one block north of the Tuesday scene.
Witnesses told authorities the vehicle involved in the shooting is a Red Toyota Camry with a blue passenger door, police said.
Investigators believe there were multiple people in the car where the shots came from but it’s unclear how many fired guns, police said.
The three other shooting victims were taken to a hospital with non-life-threatening injuries and were able to talk to detectives.
Times-Union writer Joe Daraskevich contributed to this report.
